Package io.github.hexagonnico.vecmat.vector

Interface VectorIntOperations<I extends VectorIntOperations<I>>

Type Parameters:
I - The same vector that implements this interface
All Superinterfaces:
VectorOperations<I>
All Known Implementing Classes:
Int2, Int3, Int4, IntVector
public interface VectorIntOperations<I extends VectorIntOperations<I>> extends VectorOperations<I>
Interface that defines all base operations for integer vectors.
Author:
Nico

    minus, negated, plus

  • Method Details

    • multipliedBy

      I multipliedBy(int k)
      Computes the multiplication between this vector and a scalar.

      The product between a vector v and a scalar k is a vector where every element i is the i-th element of v multiplied by k.

      Vectors are supposed to be immutable. This means that this method does not alter the object on which it is called, it returns a new vector instead.

      Parameters:
      k - The scalar to which this vector is multiplied.
      Returns:
      The product between this vector and the given scalar.

    • dividedBy

      I dividedBy(int k)
      Computes the integer division between this vector and a scalar.

      Dividing an integer vector by an integer number performs an integer division: the result of this method is still an integer vector.

      Vectors are supposed to be immutable. This means that this method does not alter the object on which it is called, it returns a new vector instead.

      Parameters:
      k - The scalar by which this vector is divided.
      Returns:
      The result of the integer division between this vector and the given scalar.

    • dotProduct

      int dotProduct(I vector)
      Computes the dot product (or scalar product) between this vector and the given one.

      The dot product between two vectors v and w of the same size is a scalar defined as the summation of the products of every element vi and wi of the two vectors.

      The dot product can only be computed between two vectors of the same size.

      Parameters:
      vector - The second operand of the product, another integer vector of the same size as this one.
      Returns:
      The result of the dot product between the two vectors.
      Throws:
      VectorMathException - if this vector and the given one have different sizes.
      NullPointerException - if the given vector is null.

    • lengthSquared

      int lengthSquared()
      Computes the squared length (or squared magnitude) of this vector.

      When one needs to compare the length of two vectors, it is best to use this method instead of length(), since given two numbers a > b, then it also holds that a^2 > b^2, and this method is more efficient since it does not compute a square root.

      Returns:
      The squared length (or squared magnitude) of this vector.

    • length

      default double length()
      Description copied from interface: VectorOperations
      Computes the length (or magnitude) of this vector.

      The length (or magnitude) of a vector is the distance between the initial point and the endpoint of a vector, or the distance between the origin of the vector space and the vector in standard position.

      Specified by:
      length in interface VectorOperations<I extends VectorIntOperations<I>>
      Returns:
      The length (or magnitude) of this vector.
